definition: lit. if the rabbit dies, the fox grieves (idiom); fig. to have sympathy with a like-minded person in distress
variant of 兔[tu4]
rabbit
to die/impassable/uncrossable/inflexible/rigid/extremely/damned
fox
sad/sadness/sorrow/grief
to be facing imminent calamity (idiom)/disaster is looming
When the tree topples the monkeys scatter. (idiom); fig. an opportunist abandons an unfavorable cause/Rats leave a sinking ship.
lit. to take joy in calamity and delight in disaster (idiom); fig. to rejoice in other people's misfortune/Schadenfreude
lit. to boil the hound once it caught the rabbit (idiom)/fig. to get rid of sb once he has served his purpose
facing imminent catastrophe/calamity looms/all hell will break loose
lit. the birds are over, the bow is put away (idiom); fig. to get rid of sb once he has served his purpose
lit. without the lips, the teeth feel the cold (idiom); fig. intimately interdependent
lit. to kill the donkey when the grinding is done (idiom)/to get rid of sb once he has ceased to be useful
a cornered beast will still fight (idiom)/to fight like an animal at bay
mournful
anxious/panicky
lit. to see a bow reflected in a cup as a snake (idiom); fig. unnecessary suspicions/overly fearful

shiver all over though not cold/tremble with fear/shudder
lit. the fox exploits the tiger's might (idiom); fig. to use powerful connections to intimidate people
